I’m neither qualified in, nor interested in, giving you the answer provided by scientific methodology, which is to say the answer provided by that way of searching for cosmological answers which relies on what seems inferred by sense imagery. Up until around 1600 AD, Science necessarily relied exclusively upon sense images acquired by the naked senses. For, up until the first telescopes and microscopes were introduced c. 1600, there were no sense images acquired with the aid of such instruments. It was naked senses’ sense images or nothing. These days, Science still relies a great deal upon the naked senses’ images but as modified by million and billion dollar super-magnifiers, colliders, and other such aids to sense experience (cf.: with what Einstein says about Science and sense experience on pages 226 & 290 of Ideas And Opinions, Bonanza Books, New York, 1954 hard bound edition). On the other hand, I’m quite possibly the supreme authority in giving the answer provided by what some might call philosophical methodology, but what I prefer to call “introspective methodology”. That’s a way of searching for cosmological answers which relies far more so upon what I judge is inferred by: (1) how my mind’s concepts (especially mathematical ones) relate to one another, and (2) my mind’s operations upon my sense images rather than upon what’s inferred by those sense images themselves. I’ve been working on that “introspective methodology” since 1957, and, the cosmological system thereby produced, I call “Esoptrics (i.e.: from “esoptron”, a Greek word for mirror), the algebraic logic of the dynamic mirror”. What, now, is “dark matter” according to Esoptrics’? Needless to say, the details amassed by what’s been under development for 63 years are far too many to set forth here. Three of my 21 self-published books in print are dedicated to doing that. Here, then, let me first give an answer too brief to mean much as it says this: For Esoptrics, dark matter and energy are realities which only appear such because an observer moving thru the universe using a lower level of locomotion’s medium (i.e.: LM for short) cannot come even remotely close to detecting adequately what’s so moving using a level of LM much higher than the observer’s. To give some level of intelligibility to that, let’s resort to a kind of figurative explanation so: Imagine an astronomical number of transparent spheres (i.e.: say 10^77) all concentric with one another in what we’ll call a multi-combo named Omega. Each sphere is distinguished from all of its fellows because, figuratively, each has a discrete “diameter” running from as little as 2^-128 to 2^128 times the atomic diameter of 5 x 10^-8 cm. (i.e.: from c. 10^-47 cm. to 18 trillion light years in “diameter”). Omega is thus what Esoptrics calls a 4 dimensional “space envelope” or, more accurately, “LM field”. In such a scenario, objects moving away from Omega’s center can do so using any one of Omega’s 10^77 concentric spheres. I’ll not go into what, per Esoptrics, determines which sphere is to be used. Imagine one of those objects, Alpha, is fleeing Omega’s center using the sphere whose “diameter” is 2^128 times that of the smallest sphere. The “diameter” of Alpha’s LM is thus only 5 x 10^-8 cm.; and so, Alpha can’t go very far from Omega’s center. Imagine another one of those objects, Beta, is fleeing Omega’s center using the sphere whose “diameter” is 2^200 times that of the smallest sphere. The “diameter” of Beta’s LM is thus 3 billion miles; and so Beta can go as far as 1.5 billion miles from Omega’s center. Image a third object, Gamma, is fleeing Omega’s center using the sphere whose “diameter” is 2^256 times that of the smallest sphere. The “diameter” of Gamma’s LM is thus 18 trillion light years; and so, Gamma can go as far as 9 trillion light years from Omega’s center. Alpha may well detect much about Beta; but, if Alpha tries to detect Gamma to any extent, Gamma is bound to appear so extensively different from Beta, that Gamma—together with any energy Gamma might radiate—is going to appear as a kind of reality totally different from what’s found in Beta. Thus, per Esoptrics, is born what can APPEAR to be dark matter and energy. The thing to remember here, though, is this: The spheres are concentric (i.e.: their centers are not outside of one another in the kind space inferred by sense imagery); and so, for some of the distances from Omega’s center, Alpha’s LM, Beta’s LM, and Gamma’s LM are the same LM as far as separation from one another in sense imagery’s kind of space is concerned. In other words, though Alpha, Beta, and Gamma are to no extent separate from one another in the terms of sense imagery’s kind of space, they are—in the terms of Esoptrics’ kind of LM—astronomically far apart from one another in “mathematically logical sequence” (i.e.: by way of example, our concepts of 1 vs. 10^77 are to no extent separate from one another in space, but are astronomically far apart in the terms of a numerically logical sequence limited to counting in the terms of our concept of 1). How can that be? The answer to that is far too complicated for here, save to say this: Rather than a “spatial” maze, the universe, for Esoptrics, is a mathematical maze the real kind of which cannot be understood, unless one is well versed in the mathematical system arising as the effect of the fact that The Infinite One’s tri-functional act automatically includes sextuplex (i.e.: 6) real relations. In short, Esoptrics is a cosmological system so radically different from all other systems, that, so far, very few people can even begin to grasp any part of it.
